item.name: 10 Days in Africa
item.comment: I can see the appeal but the gameplay just doesn't do it for me. Good subliminal geography for kids, perhaps. Not the worst game I've rated, as such, but probably the one I'd least like to play again.

item.name: 24/7: The Game
item.comment: Nice game, nice pieces but expensive in NZ for what it is. Would make a good non-gamer gift, though.
NZ's official card game ... used to play a lot before discovering modern board games. Interesting 2 player variant using 4 hands and 40 cards is pretty good.

item.name: 6 nimmt!
item.comment: Not quite as simple as No Thanks, but another great card game for several players that plays quickly and keeps everyone involved in the game.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: Two good games at Wellycon. Not sure of real long-term playablility, but a well designed game that doesn't outstay its welcome.

item.name: Ace of Aces: Handy Rotary Series
item.comment: Played this a lot with my friend Peter back in the 80s. Good fun and tense when you are down to your last point...

item.name: Acquire
item.comment:
Still a great game, quality of the 1971 edition holds up well. One page of rules, but they are well laid out and seem to cover all eventualities.
Really want to play again.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Pyramid of Horus
The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: Nicely presented game with entertaining push-your-luck play. A little dull after a few plays for gamers, and perhaps just too tricky / fiddly as a family / kids game?

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
Just one game 5 player game so far, and keen to play again. Every game will be different, and watching others activities can be as interesting as your own farm planning.
No need to own this, though.

item.name: Airships
item.comment: Roll dice to earn more dice to build up your airships. Theme and mechanics don't mesh much, but if played quickly is a good time.

item.name: Akaba
item.comment: I prefer this to The Black Pirate, but the theme is probably the main difference between the two. The timed turns involving another player keep everyone involved, and puffing is still fun.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Bought 18th Sep 2005 from new store in Featherston. Good for casual gamers, but more than four is a stretch.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: Xmas present from PMN 2006. Thanx!

item.name: Antike
item.comment: Rondel-powered european civilisation game, played once at Wellycon. I would pick Imperial over this, but for a clearer battle between players this may be your pick.

item.name: Archaeology: The Card Game
item.comment:
$25 All Aboard May 2nd 2009
Sold to Minty Jan 2010. Undemanding card game. Even enjoying the theme 3 plays was enough for this one.

item.name: Ark
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 8th April 2006. Cute cards and good concept, but the mechanics are too fiddly for non-gamers to enjoy right off, and there is not much strategy required for the length of play.

item.name: The Ark of the Covenant
item.comment: Bless your meeples with the power of the Ark. I pick Hunters & Gatherers over this as a stand-alone Carcassonne, but would be quite happy to play it.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: The original, bought 2nd hand for $50 NZ in 1990. That was a lot for a student! Tough to beat, but usually fun to play. The first themed co-op game?

item.name: Aton
item.comment: Got wasted in my only game of this, but it looks a neat two-player game with no room for mistakes, that plays quickly with meaningful decisions.

item.name: Attack!
item.comment: Only played the basic game, which came across as Risk with knobs and about as much fun. Would try it again with the expansion if pushed, but can't say I'm particularly keen.

item.name: Attika
item.comment: Missed it on original release, I would happily play Attika plenty more times.

item.name: Automobile
item.comment: Arrived 29 June 09 - $100 #717 direct from Martin Wallace.

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment: Played with Llywellyn at All Aboard. Good theme and mechanics of trying to find the right method to kill the Things is neat. It does mean some games will be unbalanced, but hey that's classic Ameritrash for you.

item.name: Axis & Allies: D-Day
item.comment: Great bits and map, and good attempt at historical accuracy. Lots of dice rolling, too. You're probably better getting Memoir '44 for this level of "wargame".

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: Uncle Douglas's set, recent games with Catriona (2012)

item.name: Bananagrams
item.comment: Multi-player crosswords game rewards word power over score optimisation. A good choice for Scrabble or crossword players.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: Quick fun with a small group, can drag with too many but don't take it seriously and you'll probably have a good time.

item.name: La Barca
item.comment: Xmas present from the 90s. Perhaps OK for a toga party?

item.name: Batavia
item.comment:
Bought from All aboard "Earthquake damaged", but no obvious sign of wear and still in shrink, $55.
Opened and played, very Euro with nice mechanics.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: Woo hoo! My record is maybe seven wins from twentyone. Getting a bit better, really need to hone my card counting. One of the most intense games I own.

item.name: Before the Wind
item.comment: The non-intuitive game play began to make some kind of sense at the end, but I don't need to play this again, i think.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 24 June 06. Kids have fun just with the pieces. Even the euro gamers have enjoyed this one so far. Equal player skill quite important.

item.name: Blokus 3D
item.comment: Deserves more plays - I like the alternate boards and lazy Susan turntable. Should be some more around now with new versions.

item.name: Blokus Trigon
item.comment: Better than Blokus with a more even board for 3 and 2 player play. Also a smaller box. Bought for Callum Dec '08.

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment: Interesting Knizia card driven game with nice bits and a post catastrophe fantasy theme. Perhaps the series of things you are collecting is one step too long, but I'm keen to play this again.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment:
Bought 11th August 2006 Good for card-playing non-gamers. 18 plays in the first year is the best on my list.
Good tramping / camping game. Three recent plays in the last month show that my group is still enjoying this one. (Jan 09)

item.name: The Bottle Imp
item.comment: I don't like a lot of trick-taking games, but I like this... includes the short story by R L Stevenson.

item.name: Britannia
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 15th March 2008.
Played 1 three-player game and had a good time getting destroyed as the Romans etc. A lot of exceptions and old school game play, but this version is great looking and it flows pretty well.

item.name: Buccaneer
item.comment: Birthday present in 1979! The pieces are very nice.

item.name: Buccaneer
item.comment: The newer Buccaneer, with interesting pile-o-pirates on to merchant ships mechanic.

item.name: The Bucket King
item.comment: A great family game where gravity helps decide your targets for winning each hand.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Great tense stand off party game. Gives you that Bang! feeling in half the time (or less). Orange guns are safer for playing at pub nights.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Uzi
item.comment: From Shire Games UK

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Yakuzas
item.comment: From All Aboard in Featherston, June 2008. Great for team play with 6 or more.

item.name: Café International: Das Kartenspiel
item.comment: A card game that plays itself. Not really any meaningful choices. Time passes OK with this.

item.name: California
item.comment: Is the materialistic theme syaing something? I did prefer this to Zooloretto, but a good game of the later has me wavering between them.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: A respectable dice-only game? Nice mechanic where knowing the odds will really help. Several other plays by others with my set, popular with non-gamers.

item.name: Captain Clueless: Lost in the Caribbean
item.comment: Trace your Carribean voyage blind-folded with limited verbal help from your team mates. Not played but inspected, and looks like a good party game for intermediate age kids.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: This rating for base Carcassonne - as high as 8 with the right mix of expansions and the right players.

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: My first euro bought June 2004

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: Won in geek gold lottery! Looks a good 2 player version of Carc with fixed space and interesting scoring.

item.name: Carcassonne: The City
item.comment: City walls help keep the tile-laying under control and give an opportunity for different scoring. OK but not particularly desired.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: Part of Peter's collection. Fun pirate leapfrog card matching game. Emile has a copy, too. Finally won a game of this and decided I would get the sequel.

item.name: Cartagena 2. The Pirate's Nest
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 5th October 2007.
The sequel adds a boat between 2 islands and a different way of getting cards back. Nice to have both games among our group, but not essential to own both.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: More suited for kids and families, this Castle Defense co-op is a bit swingy and has tactics that become fairly obvious.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Played a couple of other times before I started recording. Usually up for a game, and have had memorable times playing, just no longer a favourite.

item.name: Catan Histories: Struggle for Rome
item.comment: OK Settlers variant. Hasn't come back to games night so that might say something...

item.name: Cave Troll
item.comment: Cave Troll is a fantasy themed area-control game NOTt a "fast-paced dungeon-crawling board game of strategy, looting, and monster-bashing.." as the blurb would tell you. It's a nice game for what it is, with nice figures, but more in the vein of Dungeon Twister.

item.name: Caylus Magna Carta
item.comment: One play 2 players. Tight money game with good game play. yet to play Caylus to compare.

item.name: Château Roquefort
item.comment: Great kids game with action points, sliding tiles and cheese. It even has mice elimination! Only the cost of the wonderful bits, and the care needed to set up and play the game mark it down a little.

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: Played on my inherited grandparents round table with Callum.

item.name: Chicken Cha Cha Cha
item.comment: Pete's game for Arunan. Use your memory skills to move around the board and chase the chicken in front of you. Good attempt to do something new with the pattern-matching mechanic.

item.name: China
item.comment: Bought 12th August 2006 from All Aboard. Interesting ways of score liven up this area majority game. Neat box, good bits, deserves more love.

item.name: China Moon
item.comment:
Some good strategy, player interaction and fun components. Rated 7 for kids.
Rubber frogs are great.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment: A great negotiation / business building game. Lucky to get a chance to play this before the reprint ... I would definitely be interested. Now bought the new addition by pre-order, Dec 2008. My most expensive game at NZ$130!

item.name: Clans
item.comment: Simple pieces, great strategy - hidden players really adds to the depth.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment: Great bits, and a good game with a mix of luck and skill. The fact I've not felt the need to seek it out agaian says something, though...

item.name: Cloud 9
item.comment: David and Phillida own this cute push-your-luck card game with neat balloon basket.

item.name: Clue Mysteries
item.comment: Aimed at kids, with a good mechanism to make good dice rolls less important. Played with cousins May '08.

item.name: Clue: Discover the Secrets
item.comment: Bought for my niece, Christmas 2011 age 8. The few refinements add some control to the game and it plays pretty quickly.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: Don't take too many colours... neat set collection game.

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: Bought March 2007 from All Aboard. Read the rules, one play, one win!

item.name: Colosseum
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 3rd Anniversary sale, 13 Sep 2008.
Liked this one after a play at Wellycon, and have had a great time with each game since.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Like to play this again. Long cards or short it is a good game with great art.

item.name: Connect Four
item.comment: Portable set given to my niece. OK time killer.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: Peter's had this for 20 years (GW edition) finally got played and it went pretty well. More plays and revised ratings to come, hopefully.

item.name: Court of the Medici
item.comment: $20 All aboard Oct 2009

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment: Xmas present from Peter 2007. Scratches an RPG itch with card play and a little take-that.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Deeper & Darker
item.comment: Expansion for Cutthroat Caverns. The dragon is good, as are the individual power cards. Waiting for the RPG-like expansions that are soon to come...

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: From All Aboard, August 2010

item.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Teen Titans
Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: Ugly graphics and cliched fantasy world detract from a Pandemic clone with some good new ideas. Our close win felt genuinely exciting at the end.

item.name: Delta V
item.comment: A memory / space mining game. OK for kids if they write down where the ores are?

item.name: Detroit-Cleveland Grand Prix
item.comment: Racing game with cards to move not unlike Winner's Circle, especially if you play with hidden car ownership.

item.name: Diamant
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 20 April 2007. A push-your-luck treasure hunting game. A good games night starter, and my set has had a number of other games by other people.

item.name: Dice Town
item.comment: Bought Allaboard April 2010

item.name: Dixit Jinx
item.comment: I rocked at this quick-action, cut-down version of Dixit.

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Bought All Aboard June 2008

item.name: The Doom That Came To Atlantic City
Dragon's Gold
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 3rd anniversary sale, 13 Sep 2008. One 3 player game which ended very close. Good, and played quickly with the timer.

item.name: Drakon (third edition)
item.comment: Didn't really enjoy this one - what you do on your turn often gets cancelled out by the next player. This is another fantasy themed non-dungeon crawl.

item.name: Dream Factory
item.comment: Good fun with silly movie titles, tight auction game.

item.name: duck! duck! Go!
item.comment: Bought All Aboard Sep 12 2009. $45

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: Neat concept, great bits - shame about the mould and smell. One good game with Peter, be good to play more.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Bought All Aboard June 2008

item.name: Dungeon!
item.comment: Avoid. Not much game or nostalgia here. Play the RPG or a proper board game.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
DVONN
item.comment: OK but not great abstract. Does require some deep thought and easy to get yourself blocked out.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment: NZ$61 from Wargame Supplies - 2 close wins from 2 with 2 players.

item.name: Elk Fest
item.comment: Spirit Games Nov 2011

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: From Shire Games UK April 2010

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment:
Played with the designers on a prototype board. Excellent game for first time designers, and nice to have a Euro from this part of the world (New Zealand).
Second game with the finished version. 5 player game went in good time, different strategies and areas of development from the different players. I managed a narrow win. Hurrah!

item.name: Erosion
item.comment: From Shire Games UK April 2010

item.name: Euchre
item.comment: Played in Mitre Flats Hut with Tony and Emile. Trick taking games are not my favourite, but it played very smoothly with 3.

item.name: Expedition: Famous Explorers Promo Card – Christopher Columbus
Fairy Tale
item.comment: Magic without the budget? Not quite, but a quick, fun, set building game with generic but nicely drawn fantasy images.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
item.comment:
Christmas present from Peter ... thank you!
Bid at the right time for those hidden sacks of cats. Plays quickly with good involvement and humour.

item.name: Finca
item.comment: Bought All Aboard Sep 2009 $75

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: Good theme, nice components.

item.name: Flippin' Frogs
item.comment: Mass-market game with rotating lily pad and frog catapults to try and land on it. All dexterity, OK but nothing new.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment:
Bought 8th October 2005 at All Aboard.
Lots of games, good fun blind bidding.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: From Peter for Christmas 2010. Thanks! Great bits, good value. Plays simply and gets gripping towards the end.

item.name: Formula D
item.comment: Bounght All Aboard Sep 2009 $120

item.name: Formula Dé
item.comment: Different characteristics for your car and trickier corners, plus the d30. New version adds extra bits and may be worth a buy at the right price.

item.name: Formula Dé Mini
item.comment:
Where was this when I was 12? I would have played it to death.
Good fun if you can resist those big number dice.
-Sold - now I have the new Formula D

item.name: Formula Motor Racing
item.comment: Change car order by game play - Guillotine meets Detroit / Cleveland. Good, quick fun.

item.name: Friedrich
item.comment: Bought March 2007 from all Aboard. I like the cards of fate and map (in German!). Not likely to get much play, but worth getting, I think.

item.name: Frutti di Mare
item.comment: Play cards to change the value of your fish, but stop at the right time or you might just devalue your stock. To many players is a bit of a lottery, but OK for 4 or so.

item.name: Funny Friends
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 15th April 2007.
If you can make the relationships and the phones work, this is a fun game with consenting adults. Love the seedy characters.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Nice bits and some interesting play mechanics. As long as you can accept that you might lose a lot of your ship without being able to do anything about it GT has a lot of fun in it. Rather expensive down our way, however.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion
item.comment: Great for the grand masters of GT, but does turn the game into a serious analytical challenge. For me, it does remove some of the fun of the base game.

item.name: The Game of Life
item.comment: As a free game to play with a 5 year old it's OK. No other reason to play. As far as teaching kids about life it's dubious at best.

item.name: The Gardens of the Alhambra
item.comment: Good quick game; nice pieces. Not sure of the long term interest - perhaps the lack of options mean it may not have lasting appeal.

item.name: Genesis
item.comment: Prehistoric themed Knizia tile laying game. Interesting but not essential.

item.name: Genoa
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard $67 July 09
Old Traders of Genoa version

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment: Bought 20 Feb 2009, $105 All Aboard Featherston

item.name: Ghost Stories: White Moon
item.comment: From Shire Games UK April 2010

item.name: Gloria Mundi
item.comment: Didn't have the best of first games with rules unclear. The idea of running from the barbarians with your loot makes a interesting theme, it probably deserves another play.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 14th September 2006. NZ$86

item.name: Gravediggers
item.comment: I didn't mind this Knizia, but it is fiddly and a bit too luck based for me. Not one I need to own.

item.name: GUBS: A Game of Wit and Luck
Guillotine
item.comment: Light head hunting game, played fast and fun.

item.name: Gulo Gulo
item.comment: Great for kids or as an ice breaking / drinking game. Cute wolverines.

item.name: Halli Galli
item.comment: Spot 5 of the same fruit and hit the bell to win. A quick game, good for kids and families.

item.name: Hammer of the Scots
item.comment:
Birthday present 2009 - thanks Peter!
Ist editon map with amended rules.

item.name: Hamsterrolle
item.comment: New for Peter December 2007. Needs a level surface and a steady hand.

item.name: Hang on Harvey!
item.comment: Fun two play game that teaches about centre of momentum and gravity, and risk, as two players race each other to the bottom.

item.name: Heave Ho!
item.comment: Bought All Aboard Sep 2009 $42

item.name: Hex Hex
item.comment: Deflect the hex on to other players and be the last wizard standing. OK, would play again.

item.name: Hey! That's My Fish!
item.comment: Great game for kids or adults. Cost for what you get put me off, but Pete has it, and I would buy it if cheap enough.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: Cute penguins, smaller tiles OK for size and thickness, very neat package and much cheaper here in NZ. It improves on the first edition for me.

item.name: Hide and Eeek!
item.comment: A fun die rolling and hunt-the-mice card match game. Fun with kids.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Great pieces, and now I understand how I'm losing (though still yet to win) it is fun.

item.name: Hula Hippos
item.comment:
Hula Hippos version, NZ$29. Nice details on the wooden bits. Quite tricky on first play.
A light carpet is better than a hard wooden table or floor - less scattering of pieces. Rewards practice!

item.name: I Go!
item.comment: Pirate themed set collection card game.

item.name: Igloo Pop
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 3/2010 NZ$37

item.name: Illuminati
item.comment: 2 players is no good. This is really PMN's game, so he might take it back on the next visit...

item.name: Imperial
item.comment: Played 3, 4 and 5 player games - nice twist on the euro conquest game where money and economic control, not military might , is the name of the game.

item.name: Industrial Waste
item.comment: A smart game of Pete's, which would be great to play again.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment:
Good abstract. Good bits, plays quite quickly with some thought required. Birthday present 2006.
At least 4 other plays by others at games nights, a keeper.

item.name: It's Alive!
item.comment: $49 from All Aboard 18/12/08. Not just Beetle Drive with money, this has a nice mechanic for keeping player's finances under control. Deciding whether to risk an auction makes for some fun play.

item.name: The Jumbo Book of Board Games
Ka-Ching!
item.comment: Two player game of set collection. Need to balance your best score against an opponents makes for an interesting challenge.

item.name: Karottenklau
item.comment: Lovely wooden bits in the game of carrot farming and rabbit racing.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: A fun game, but I have doubts about its long term appeal. Played 3, won 3. Even has frikin' lasers!

item.name: King of the Tabletop
item.comment: First print and play ... still have (Peter's) copy of Dragon it came from, but the game itself has gone in the mists of time. Next time I'll use thinner cardboard.

item.name: King's Gate
item.comment: Knizia mixture of Kingdoms and Samurai. Some nice mechanics, and enough special options to give you a chance of catching the leader.

item.name: Lascaux
item.comment: A fun but sometimes infuriating bidding game, very much a cross between For Sale and No Thanks! The animals are a little difficult to tell apart but all the rest of the components are of good quality. Requires more thinking than No Thanks but about the same as For Sale.

item.name: Liar's Dice
item.comment: 6 player Perudo with plastic cups though nice bag. Plays quickly for a player elimination game, some tactics and bluffing make it worth while.

item.name: Lifeboats
item.comment: Fun enough negotiation / screwage game, but extremely overpriced at NZ$95.

item.name: Light Speed
item.comment: Kids of 8+ who like space ships should ALL own this game. Not sure if there's a way to make the card placing more skillful, but scoring is fun anyway.

item.name: Linwood
item.comment: Light medium for a family game, light for a strategy game.

item.name: London
item.comment: Number 171 in the limited edition run! Arrived November 9th 2010.

item.name: Loot
item.comment: A party pirate game that play up to 8. Laughs and good confusion in a big group; some real strategy with smaller numbers away from the booze. All Aboard 6 Jan 2006.

item.name: Lord of the Rings
item.comment:
From Peter after he got another copy with all the supplements. Played one solo game - be interesting to see who goes for this one.
Won one and lost one of the standard game. Even if it is a little gamey, enough of the theme comes through to make this an intense and enjoyable co-op game.
Update: Back to Peter for his rental business.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
item.comment: Seemed to make it harder, though we did have a very bad run of luck in our game. Does give extra choices, boards and allies to complete the LOTR flavour.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
item.comment: Smart LOTR themed Stratego where every piece has a separate power, plus cards to adjust the battles. Bought for PMN Xmas 07.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment:
Still not sure how I feel about this. I'm very bad at it, for some reason.
I got better with my third play. You need to build buildings for long term success.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: Prefer Battleline as a 2-player card game between gamers. Be interesting to try the new multi-player, though.

item.name: Lost Worlds
item.comment:
Skeleton, Fighter with Chainmail and Mage Warrior. Unique viewpoint at the time, instant fighting fantasy fix.
Not as good as Ace of Aces, though.

item.name: Louis XIV
item.comment:
Bought March 2007, All Aboard.
Played once, need to play again! Lots of play in a small box.

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.comment: Tricky Knizia. Be good to play again with less players.

item.name: Make 'n' Break Extreme
item.comment: Block building against the clock, entertaining dexterity puzzle game.

item.name: Mall of Horror
item.comment: Don't take it personally and this is a fun game of zombie survival. Good bits and well presented, tense and true to its theme.

item.name: Mansions of Madness
item.comment: A lot of setup, a few unbalanced scenarios, but the quality of bits and atmosphere make this worthwhile. Needs to be played as an RPG for maximum fun.

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Call of the Wild
Marrakech
item.comment: Fun carpet laying game, where building a stack of carpets and staying off other people's carpets is the challenge. Good for teaching probability (and the size of risk) to kids.

item.name: Masons
item.comment: Better after a play with someone who had played before. You'd better agree on exactly what the cards mean before you start, though.

item.name: Medici
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 9th Sep 2007. Just one game of this pure auction Knizia game. I like it and hope I can get it played more.

item.name: Metro
item.comment: OK fun tile laying / track making game. Board is a bit busy, but the style is good. Fits in good size, even with 5 players. Getting a coherent strategy is hard, however.

item.name: Metropolys
item.comment: The art is a little confusing, but the mechanics and secret bonuses make for an intriguing game.

item.name: Mexica
item.comment: Mask trilogy game that plays quite well with 3. deserves another game. Prefer Tikal at this stage.

item.name: Mission: Red Planet
item.comment: Citadels meets area-control game with Vernian steam-punk theme. Good, though the secret bonuses can sometimes cause swings of scoring that are too big.

item.name: Mmm ... Brains!
item.comment: Knizia brain collecting and eating game. Don't think the strategy is up to much, and the colours on the dice are indistinct, but the rubber brains are very cute.

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: Must try this Knizia auction game again with Emile, next time we have 4 or more.

item.name: Monopoly Deal Card Game
item.comment: OK for a Monopoly theme in a quick card game format. Luck plays a large part, so play quickly.

item.name: Monopoly: London
item.comment:
Sister's birthday / Xmas 1978?
Be interesting to see if it gets any play from the next generation...
Finally played with my niece 2 player. Ran out of time, the result was a tie after totalling all our properties!

item.name: Monte Rolla
item.comment: Rated 4 for adults with adults,6 for adults with kids and 7 for kids playing with kids. A roll and move game with gravity and marbles. Neat idea!

item.name: Montgolfiere
item.comment: Better for kids, but there is some strategy and a real card counter will do very well towards the end of the game. Nice board and theme.

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: Well, it's Fluxx, but it is Monty python. The version I would play if I had to, but not as much fun as watching the series.

item.name: Monza
item.comment: Kid's colour based racing game.

item.name: Munchkin Bites!
item.comment: Yes, yes it does. In-jokes for RPGers are fun, and if you like take-that game play then go for it. Too long and with player elimination.

item.name: Municipium
item.comment: From Peter for Xmas 2009. Cheers!

item.name: My First Carcassonne
item.comment: Great stuff. Quick and simple for adults and kids. Playable with kids from age 3 and a bit and up, from my experience.

item.name: Mykerinos
item.comment:
Bought 15th March 2008
Like the theme and choices, quite brain-burning for a small game.

item.name: Mystery Express
item.comment: Nice to see this replace Cluedo, but too tricky for non-gamer families. Clock watching not that tricky when you work it out.

item.name: N-Tropy
item.comment: Stick-stacking dexterity game. Pretty good but inessential.

item.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game
item.comment:
I don't hate it as much as Tom Vasel (who does?) but this is the least of the Carcassonne games, and could be down right un-fun if the wrong tiles come out time and time again.
A better recent game where the fight for fields was quite interesting. Still, I wouldn't pick this version unless it was the onlt one available.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: Glow-in-the-dark monster-em-up in space. Catch up mechanism makes it friendly for newbies, and you'll always remember the vital dice rolls that won the game.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment:
Home made version, for when others get left behind. (Can also use the Chinatown tiles).
Good, fast and light but there is strategy that newbies will need to learn.

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment: Stop those rats and dominate your slice of Paris. On the list to play again soon. 2, 3 and 5 player games now played - very fine with all.

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment: A family game with tricky line-of-sight rules? Seems fun, but it's a very fiddly version of Scotland Yard.

item.name: On the Underground
item.comment: An interesting track laying game. It's very interactive because all players can see what your best move is - in our group we can't help offering advice, which may get wearing. Fond memories of using the Underground help.

item.name: Owner's Choice
item.comment: OK stock trading game. Not really up my alley, but diverting for a while.

item.name: Pacific Typhoon
item.comment: WW2 Pacific Theatre themed card game that's just OK, but saved by the history lessons and nice card pictures.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment:
The board is too small and the pieces too big, and you may sometimes lose before you get a chance to play. These are the only major negative points.
On the plus side it's a quick playing co-operative game with a theme that engages almost anyone who tries it. Hard to just play it once after it's set up.

item.name: Parade
item.comment: Go short or go bust? A neat card game you could play with two standard card decks - better with more players, I feel.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Skinsaw Murders Adventure Deck 2
Patrician
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 3rd June 2008. Now available from boardgamerentals.

item.name: Perry Rhodan: The Cosmic League
item.comment: Plays well as a two player pick up and deliver game with Sf theme.

item.name: Piece o' Cake
item.comment: From Shire Games UK

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: Well structured game, very thematic. Not as much fun-per-play as Stoneage, but ebjoyable.

item.name: Piratissimo
item.comment: Kid's roll and move pirate game is pretty good with some take-that and options in moving cyclone.

item.name: Pit
item.comment: Had this as kids - a great game for family and plays well to 6. Spoons variant is fun.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: Just flick to race! Great pub dexterity game with or without serious gamers. Hard to afford an official copy in this neck of the woods.

item.name: Poker
item.comment: Most plays over New Year's 07/08 - great tension from a simple game. We had up to 8 players starting, so that no-one had to wait too long for a different game.

item.name: Pop Belly
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 13 Sep 2008
Kids like the pigs and like other popping them. OK for two, but 4 may play too long for littlies.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: Bought 8th October 2005 at All Aboard. Upgraded to a 9 - the most popular big game with my groups.

item.name: Power Grid: China/Korea
item.comment: Played China -fixed power plant order makes for straight early game play, before the rush as the free market kicks in.

item.name: Power Grid: France/Italy
item.comment: France has nukes, Italy has tricky geography...but how will they play? Only 2 games so far (May 06) but I'm upgrading this, too...

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
item.comment: Thanks to Peter, Xmas gift 2007. Need a few more games to see the long term effects of the new deck.

item.name: Primordial Soup
item.comment:
Bought All Aboard 3rd Anniversary sale 13 Sep 2008
Took less than a year to get it to the table! One test game and one 3-player game. Fun theme, nice gameplay with options to point-scoring and building your ultimate amoeba.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: One 3 player game of PoF was good, be great to play again soon and try a different mix of strategy.

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment: Too long and random, but OK fantasy runaround for teens. I did enjoy becoming Beastmaster, though.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Didn't come to this until later, so doesn't seem quite as revolutionary to me as. Well integrated mechanics if a little dry. I appreciate PR without being desperate to play it often.

item.name: Quicksand
item.comment: Played at games night. Fun with lots of players, but a little too luck based.

item.name: Quo Vadis?
item.comment: A voting game that relies on future promises as you try to gain power in the roman Republic. OK with strangers but better shenanigans with friends.

item.name: Quoridor
item.comment: Bought for Xmas 2012, NZ$25 Whitcoulls sale

item.name: Qwirkle
item.comment: I may like this better with more plays, but I prefer Ingenious.

item.name: R-Eco
item.comment: A neat card game where the theme of garbage collection fits quite neatly with taking points or taking cards that cost points.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: The Eqyptian auction collection set game. Good if pasted theme, tense interesting game.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Still learning, really but a logical expansion of San Juan and interesting to play.

item.name: Railways of the World
item.comment: Good rail management game. First play made me want to play again immediately. 3hrs go past pretty quickly. Like the negative money!

item.name: RattleSnake
item.comment: Magnet clicking game for kids and families. Nice idea, simple game.

item.name: Reef Encounter
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 15th March 2008. - Still to play!

item.name: Reiner Knizia's Amazing Flea Circus
item.comment: Kid's card game with cute rubber animals. Better than standard Uno, at least.

item.name: Return of the Heroes
item.comment: From Peter as a birthday present.

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: Thought I was buying Robot Rally! Bought 18th Sep 2005. A big hit with some players, a complete turn-off for others.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: Finally played April 2007 - good fun game, though it could be very frustrating.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: $55 from All Aboard Oct 2009

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment: Bought 9 Sep 2007. Light but entertaining with the right group. Worth trying to play a number of hands to even out the luck. Bumped up a touch after an entertaining play at pre-wellycon 2011.

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: I wanted to like this more, and will try again with the expansion.

item.name: Samurai
item.comment: Bought on the strength of Through the Desert and the Japanese theme. Two player is perhaps a bit reactive, but the differing value of pieces played gives Samurai added strategy. Lovely plexiglass bits.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: Bought from All Aboard 21/01/2006 Great building card game. Gets lots of play.

item.name: San Marco
item.comment:
Bought 24th June 2007. Just in case it disappears. One game so far, enjoy the mechanics and good with 4 players.
Now two games, deserves to be played more. I should have less games!

item.name: Santiago
item.comment: Potentially a game of pure evil. Don't join in a field unless you're going to be the biggest - take a bribe and shut off their water instead!

item.name: Der schwarze Pirat
item.comment: Puff-powered pirate treasure game. Getting the strength of blow right is tricky. The Black pirate can get down right annoying. Good fun.

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: Chase the crook game that also teaches you about the London transport system (not guaranteed up to date). Better for families, but a worthy game.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: Had a great game last month where I started with a 7 letter word but couldn't hold on to my lead - three players finished within 6 points. Fun when you're in the right mood.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: Simple to play but tricky to keep track of effects and bonus / minus powers. Good theme, though.

item.name: Ships
item.comment: Played prototype Wellycon 2014. Good mix of Automobile and Endeavour with good resource management ideas of its own.

item.name: Shipwrights of the North Sea
item.comment: Arrived 15 Oct 2014 from Kickstarter.

item.name: Shogun
item.comment:
Slightly dented box for $10 off... with my discount that's NZ$55!
Have had one 5 player game - I love the way the order of everything changes. Far more euro than wargame, and requires a lot of planning.

item.name: Shopping List
item.comment: Good fun for 3-year-olds. Pieces are more solid and robust than card matching games and good for small fingers. $21 NZ All Aboard.

item.name: Skybridge
item.comment: Coffee-table block building game. Straight-forward for casual gamers but interesting enough for everyone to try.

item.name: Slide 5
item.comment: Bought 20th Feb 2009, All Aboard Featherston $15.

item.name: Small World
item.comment: Fantasy Vinci deserves its success, but I'd rather play the earlier game.

item.name: Snow Tails
item.comment: Neat race game with fast players and the right board.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment: Kids to adults dexterity game. Use shuffleboard skills to earn points to get your score markers "home". Far better than any other game with Sorry! in the title.

item.name: Space Dealer
item.comment: Played one 4 player game. A little chaotic, and perhaps best played with a referee but good fun and a unique experience.

item.name: Space Hulk
item.comment: One of three sets bought from Germany - thanks Peter!

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
Speed Circuit
item.comment: Neat car racing game with no random elements, just unique characteristics for each car. Perhaps not as much fun as Detroit / Cleveland or Formula Motor Racing, but a good game.

item.name: Sticheln
item.comment: Evil trick taking game where you set your own 'pain suit'.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: Really like this. Once you understand the odds of dice rolling and the power of end scoring this game is far more than "which of 3 options to pick first". Theme seems to work better than Pillars of the Earth for most.

item.name: Stone Age: The New Huts
item.comment: From Shire Games UK with a big order - thanks!

item.name: La Strada
item.comment: Didn't really enjoy this route connection tile laying game. It was quick, but that was about it.

item.name: StreetSoccer
item.comment: Great fun soccer game with quite real-feeling tactics.

item.name: Subbuteo
item.comment:
Display edition 1980 Astroturf pitch 1982
Good exciting tabletop soccer - used to play nearly every week for 3 or 4 years in my preteen days.

item.name: Subbuteo Cricket
item.comment:
Christmas 1978
A great time consuming kids game for wet days - can be played by one with some dexterity. Like all cricket games, scoring rate is too fast.

item.name: Subbuteo Rugby
item.comment:
1978? My Dad preferred this one, so we played a weekly league for quite a while.
More fiddly than soccer, and the penalty kicking is too easy - shots from 80 (scale) metres are no problem.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! Dolphins & Dive Dice Mini Extension
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
Taj Mahal
item.comment: I failed badly on my only game, but would like to try "poker for elephants" again!

item.name: Take a Train
item.comment:
Peter's game, from unknown source...
Nice pieces but a broken game.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: $115 All Aboard Oct 2009. One play 6-player, too long for a first game, but a great time. Good value for the gorgeous map and graphics.

item.name: That's Life!
item.comment: Bought Arty Bees 28 Feb 2009 NZ$28. From Frank?

item.name: Thebes
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 5th October 2007. Theme really appeals to me. Bumped up the ratings after some great games with two of my game groups. Don't mind the luck of the draw as this is a fun experience even if you have no chance of winning half-way through.

item.name: There's a Moose in the House
Thieves of Bagdad
item.comment: OK game of meeple placement and burglary.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: A story of civilization is right. The fiddly counters are better dealt with by computers to be honest,but I could be persuaded to try this again.

item.name: Through the Desert
item.comment:
Colour-coded-candy camel fun.
Trickier than the pastel pieces would make you think. Quick and several ways to win. Scales well.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: Didn't thrill me, but perfectly OK game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: Best version for big groups (of those I've played). We don't always use the stations depending on numbers. A default game for some groups.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: I didn't quite grokk this and would like to play it again. It would mean more to train fans, but the passengers does add another scoring element.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: OK for two, 3 probably better. You may need to agree on ticket scoring rules if constant ticket drawing annoys you.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Bought at All Aboard 14th September 2006. Would get more play if I had less games1

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 14th September 2006. NZ$58

item.name: Tiki Topple
item.comment: Formula Motor racing like game of swapping positions to score for your hidden Tiki.

item.name: Tinners' Trail
item.comment: From Shire Games UK April 2010

item.name: Toledo
item.comment: Bought All Aboard Featherston 20 Feb 2009, $85.

item.name: Toss Your Cookies
item.comment: Kids cookie collecting game. Quick fun, good enough to eat.

item.name: A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
Trans Europa
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 3/2010 NZ$35. Well worth it with vexation, a quicker Ticket to Ride where you help each other... a little.

item.name: Turn the Tide
item.comment: Similar to For Sale, but the fact everyone plays each hand of cards in turn means that no-one should feel that there has been luck in the game.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: Great scope, big feeling space game with plenty of pieces and several routes to victory with this expansion. Eurofication seems to have helped this above 2nd edition.

item.name: Ultimate Mastermind
item.comment: Dunno whose present this was. Good game for kids around ages 8-10. Pieces and board have lasted very well.

item.name: UNO Attack!
item.comment: The battery powered card spitter makes this more fun. A decent enough time waster.

item.name: Unspeakable Words
item.comment: From Chaosium thanks to a gift certificate. More a piece of Cthulhu-ana than a game I first thought, but the balancing scale of the sanity roll helps keep this game close between players of different skill levels, at least.

item.name: The Very Clever Pipe Game
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 8th April 2006. NZ$10!

item.name: Vikings
item.comment: Theme doesn't fit too well, but interesting mechanics and quality components. Play the advanced game out of the box.

item.name: Vinci
item.comment: A good game that nearly everyone can enjoy. Manages an epic feel just by a map of Europe and differing civilisations and with simple combat. Deep but not too complex.

item.name: Vinhos
item.comment: Hard to grokk, but intriguing game with that full-bodied, winey theme.

item.name: Wasabi!
item.comment: Played once and just bought "the last copy in NZ" on 24th Jan 09. Wonderful bits in a simple game. Hard to make long-term strategy but great value compared to some recent games.

item.name: What's GNU?
item.comment: Three letter spelling for kids with good physical components. You know, for the kids.

item.name: Who Stole Ed's Pants?
item.comment: Too complex for immediate play with newbies. The flavour text is fun and the right level of desparation sets in as you try to pin another player for the hideous crime before time runs out.

item.name: Why Did the Chicken...?
item.comment: No, sorry. A game where you have to make up jokes on the spot from cards that are drawn. Forced humour at the best of times; often the reaction was just puzzled silence.

item.name: Wicked Witches Way
item.comment: Find the unique symbols on sets of coloured dice quicker than your opponents to win the witches' race. Very nice presentation, and a good simple game that has been well thought out.

item.name: Wild Vikings
item.comment: Only played 2 players. Kid's card game where you try to score for your invading viking boat. Could be quite good with 4 or so - similar to Loot.

item.name: Wildlife Safari
item.comment: Nice Modern Art-lite (very lite) card game where controlling the value of the chips is the name of the game. Won as a prize from Wellycon 2008.

item.name: Wings of War: Burning Drachens
item.comment: Big balloons and interesting missions make this a worthy add-on to the base game.

item.name: Wings of War: Famous Aces
item.comment: Bought All Aboard April 06. Plotted movement dogfighting game. Better with 4 players or a scenario. Best to dump the instant-death cards for an even game.

item.name: Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II
item.comment: Bought All Aboard 9th Sep 2007

item.name: Winner's Circle
item.comment: Good party / pub game with betting. More strategy than it might appear...

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: The best party quiz game I've played. US-centric questions, but the betting system means it doesn't matter if no-one knows the answer.

item.name: The World Cup Game: Expansion Set 1
ZÈRTZ
item.comment: Only played once and need to try again. Another clever abstract.

item.name: Zing!
item.comment: Collect enough but not too much. Fun card game.
